thread.title: Berry takes over first place with 27-24 victory over Hendrix
thread.title_full: Berry takes over first place with 27-24 victory over Hendrix

author: David McCollum
title: Berry takes over first place with 27-24 victory over Hendrix
text:
Berry takes over first place with 27-24 victory over Hendrix Posted: October 17, 2015 - 10:36pm By David McCollum LOG CABIN STAFF WRITER 
Berry’s Vikings threw a roadblock Saturday into Hendrix’s bid for a Southern Athletic Association title at Mount Berry, Georgia. 
In a contest of third-year startup programs, the Vikings (6-1, 5-0) took over sole possession of first place with a 27-24 victory over the Warriors (4-2, 3-1). 
The Warriors generated 475 yards in total offense but was hurt by two turnovers, a fumble and an interception. 
Hendrix took a 10-0 lead early on a 23-yard field goal by Stephen Crenshaw and a 4-yard run by Dayton Winn. 
Then, the Vikings scored 27 straight points on drives of 66, 75, 26 and a 28-yard punt return. 
Peters passed 21 yards to Ben Luedtke and 36 yards to Ethan Hoppe to draw the Warriors within 27-24 with 3:53 left. 
Peters was 26 of 39 yards for 292 yards and two touchdowns. 
A key for Berry was holding Winn to 131 yards on 30 carries. 
The Warriors continue their tough road swing Saturday against the University of Chicago.
